documents.t: You can use the following flags and options to customize behavior:
Generate a new baseline file (ignore current issues)
Run only on a specific path
Export lint report as JSON (for CI)
Improving usability for smaller terminal sizes

Laravel,  migrations,  linter,  PHP,  CI/CD,  database,  schema,  sufyandev
A lightweight Laravel package that analyzes your database migrations and warns you about risky schema changes ‚Äî before they reach production.

‚úÖ Detects dangerous migration operations (like adding non-nullable columns without defaults). ‚úÖ Warns about missing indexes on foreign key columns. ‚úÖ Warns when columns are dropped (data loss risk). ‚úÖ Warns when float() is used for money fields (precision issue). ‚úÖ Warns when adding unique constraints to existing data. ‚úÖ Configurable rule severities (info, warning, error). ‚úÖ Baseline support to ignore known legacy issues. ‚úÖ CLI report with JSON output & colorized table. ‚úÖ Ready for CI/CD integration (GitHub Actions support).
A lightweight Laravel package that analyzes your database migrations and warns you about risky schema changes ‚Äî before they reach production.

‚úÖ Detects dangerous migration operations (like adding non-nullable columns without defaults). ‚úÖ Warns about missing indexes on foreign key columns. ‚úÖ Warns when columns are dropped (data loss risk). ‚úÖ Warns when float() is used for money fields (precision issue). ‚úÖ Warns when adding unique constraints to existing data. ‚úÖ Configurable rule severities (info, warning, error). ‚úÖ Baseline support to ignore known legacy issues. ‚úÖ CLI report with JSON output & colorized table. ‚úÖ Ready for CI/CD integration (GitHub Actions support).
All notable changes to this project will be documented here.

üÜï Added‚Äã DropColumnWithoutBackup rule ‚Äî warns when columns are dropped without confirmation. AddUniqueConstraintOnNonEmptyColumn rule ‚Äî warns when adding unique constraints that might fail on existing data. FloatColumnForMoney rule ‚Äî warns when using float() for monetary fields; recommends decimal(10,2) instead. ‚öôÔ∏è Improved‚Äã Output formatting improvements for smaller terminals.
üÜï Added‚Äã Core engine and command: php artisan migrate:lint Base rules: AddNonNullableColumnWithoutDefault, MissingIndexOnForeignKey. Config publishing, baseline ignoring, JSON report output.
Laravel Migration Linter works perfectly inside GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and other automation pipelines.

name: Laravel Migration Linter on: push: branches: [ main, master ] pull_request: branches: [ main, master ] jobs: lint-migrations: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v4 - uses: shivammathur/setup-php@v2 with: php-version: 8.3 extensions: mbstring, pdo, bcmath, curl, dom, xml tools: composer:v2 - run: composer create-project laravel/laravel test-laravel-app --quiet - run: | cd test-laravel-app composer config repositories.sufyandev path ../ composer require sufyandev/laravel-migration-linter:@dev --no-interaction php artisan migrate:lint --json > lint-report.json
The Laravel Migration Linter ships with a default configuration file that defines all available rules and severity thresholds.

return [ 'severity_threshold' => 'warning', 'rules' => [ 'AddNonNullableColumnWithoutDefault' => [ 'enabled' => true, 'severity' => 'warning', ], 'MissingIndexOnForeignKey' => [ 'enabled' => true, 'severity' => 'warning', ], 'DropColumnWithoutBackup' => [ 'enabled' => true, 'severity' => 'warning', ], 'AddUniqueConstraintOnNonEmptyColumn' => [ 'enabled' => true, 'severity' => 'warning', ], 'FloatColumnForMoney' => [ 'enabled' => true, 'severity' => 'warning', ], ], ];
Level Description Exit Code info Informational only 0 warning May cause performance issues or risk 0 error Serious migration-breaking issues 1

Install via Composer: composer require sufyandev/laravel-migration-linter --dev The package will auto-register via Laravel‚Äôs package discovery. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Run the Linter Use the built-in Artisan command to lint all migrations: php artisan migrate:lint
This package currently ships with five major rules. Each rule can be enabled, disabled, or adjusted for severity in config/migration-linter.php.
Warns when adding a NOT NULL column without a default value to existing tables. Severity: warning
Detects when a foreign key column (like user_id, order_id) lacks an index. Severity: warning
Warns when columns are dropped without explicit confirmation or backup. Severity: warning
Warns when adding unique constraints that could fail on existing duplicate data. Severity: warning
Warns when float() is used for money-like columns (e.g., price, amount, cost). üí° Recommendation: Use decimal(10,2) instead. Severity: warning
After installing the package, lint your migrations with: php artisan migrate:lint

Option / Flag Description --generate-baseline Create a JSON file to skip known existing issues (useful for legacy projects). --path= Lint a specific file or directory instead of database/migrations. --json Output structured JSON (useful for CI/CD integration). --baseline= Provide a custom baseline file path (overrides the default). --compact Output shorter table view for smaller terminals. Example Usage
documents.s: You can use the following flags and options to customize behavior:
Generate a new baseline file (ignore current issues)
Run only on a specific path
Export lint report as JSON (for CI)
Improving usability for smaller terminal sizes

documents.t: Laravel Migration Linter is designed to be extensible. You can create your own rule classes to handle specific migration patterns.

Inside your app or a custom package, create a new class that extends the base rule: namespace App\MigrationRules; use Sufyandev\MigrationLinter\Rules\BaseRule; class NoUnsignedBigIntRule extends BaseRule { public function check($migration) { if (str_contains($migration, 'unsignedBigInteger')) { return $this->warn('Avoid using unsignedBigInteger for portability.'); } return $this->pass(); } }
Add your new rule to the configuration file: // config/migration-linter.php 'rules' => [ // existing rules... 'NoUnsignedBigIntRule' => [ 'enabled' => true, 'severity' => 'warning', ], ],
php artisan migrate:lint Your new rule will now be included in the linting process.
